column1: In early versions of the [[legendarium]], '''''Fôs' Almir''''' (the '''Bath of Flame'''),<ref name=LT2II/> also called '''''Faskalan''''', '''''Faskala-númen''''' (the '''Bath of the Setting Sun''') and '''''Tanyasalpë''''' (the bowl of fire),<ref name=LT1/> was a purifying bath into which [[Túrin]] and [[Nienor
The bath was fashioned as a great basin with golden floor and walls of polished bronze. An "arcade of golden pillars topped with fires engirdled it" and [[Yavanna]] "set a great and nameless [[Magic
column2: spell]] around it, so that therein was poured the most of the waters of the fruit of the noon and it became a bath of fire".<ref name=LT1>{{LT1

column1: ''Fôs' Almir'' is a [[Gnomish]] name, meaning "Galmir's bath, i.e. [[Sun]]'s bath".<ref name=PE11>{{PE
A rejected name used in earlier texts for the bath was '''''Fauri'''''.<ref name=LT2IIn/>
''Fôs' Almir'' appears to also have been used by [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column2: Tolkien]] as a name for the [[Belegaer
